column1: #        X         X         X         X         X         X         X        80
# This comparison was compiled by hand; it is far from exhaustive and not all
# syntax and their peculiarities are covered.
# To have a brid’s eye overview compare which markers they use, find conflicting
# markdown dialects not separately mentioned, unless they differ from original Markdown
# reST is a different beast than other LWMLs!

# many lightweight markup languages also offer conversion of special sorts (characters) into html &entities; - not covered here, as is not markup stricto sensu, but workaround for pre-Unicode encoding and character input method
# directives not included (like in AsciiDoc uses directives like `image:`, `link:`, `xref:`)
# Textile uses h1. h2. h3. h4. h5. h6. directives for headers, bq. for blockquote, fn1. for footnote text
# ␣ mandatory single whitespace, whereas regular space (u????) for optional white space
#   replace string by Text and word!
# Only some [^CSV] implementations parse lines at the beginning of the file
# starting with a # (hash) as comments; graphical user interfaces (GUI; c.q.
# CVS editors) using such parser will not interprete these lines as rows
# belonging to the table (data), but as metadata. Obviously, that is the
# assumed behavior for the present document. If you can read these lines from
# within your GUI editor, then open this file in a plain text editor, remove all
# lines at the top starting with a #, save, and re-open in your GUI.

column7: forced line break within a paragraph

column6: markdown; Creole, reST, Setext, Skriv, Textile

column7: interpreted text (rendering is domain- or application-dependent)
highlighted text, e.g. with a colored fluo marker background
comment, text removed from in output
enumerated list item starting by number eight
definition list item with term and single description
definition list item with term and multiple descriptions
“listing block”, used for code or file listings
single line comment, not in output
preformatted text, with further syntax parsing
preformatted text block without any further syntax parsing
label definition with url and title attributes
footnote marker with page number and reference to bibliographic address
inline footnote text with custom footnote marker (label)

column6: Textile footnote marker; the number is the actual identifier
reST footnote marker; the number is the actual identifier; can be any other string, e.g. the sigil of a citation reference

column7: image with alt text and title
inline variable placeholder with extension name and parameters
block placeholder with extension name, parameters, and input
server or client side file include
